article.headline: Army 62, Hartford 53
article.story: WEST POINT, N.Y. (AP) -- Matt Bell scored 17 points and Jarell Brown contributed 16 to lead Army in a 62-53 win over Hartford Saturday. Alex Zimnickas led Hartford (0-3) with 16 points and hit his first four shots of the game to give the Hawks a strong start. Hartford went ahead by seven on a driving layup by Jaret Von Rosenberg. Bo Taylor, who scored 13, followed up with a fadeaway jumper to put the lead at 20-13. Army (3-1) responded with defensive pressure, holding the Hawks without a field goal for nearly 10 minutes and outscoring Hartford, 13-0 to take a 26-20 lead. Hartford finally stopped the run on a Zimnickas basket with less than two minutes left in the half and scored five points to trail 26-25. Army continued its surge in the second half, opening the period with a 21-6 spurt to grab a 47-31 lead. Hartford responded with a 10-0 run to cut the advantage to 47-41. Another three-pointer from Corban Bates upped Army's lead to 50-41, but a quick 6-2 run by Hartford brought the Hawks to within five at 52-47. That's as close as they would get, as Army converted its free throws down the stretch to secure the win.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
